intro: Psychotria emetica, commonly known as the "arrow poison plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including the potent neurotoxin curare, which has been historically used by indigenous peoples for hunting. Its roots and leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their stimulant and hallucinogenic properties. Due to its toxic nature, it is often cultivated in controlled environments for research and medicinal purposes.
